text: THE SKY WAS A DEEP SHADE OF BLUE.
SHE FOLDED THE LAUNDRY AND PUT IT AWAY.
HE TOOK A DEEP BREATH AND CLOSED HIS EYES.
THE BOOKSHELF WAS OVERFLOWING WITH BOOKS.
THEY WALKED ALONG THE BEACH, HAND IN HAND.
THE PIZZA WAS TOPPED WITH PEPPERONI AND MUSHROOMS.
SHE SMILED AND WAVED GOODBYE AS SHE WALKED OUT THE DOOR.
THE SUN WAS SETTING BEHIND THE MOUNTAINS.
HE RAN HIS FINGERS THROUGH HIS HAIR AND SIGHED.
THE BABY SLEPT SOUNDLY IN HER CRIB.
THE FLOWERS IN THE GARDEN WERE IN FULL BLOOM.
THE CLOCK ON THE WALL TICKED LOUDLY.
THEY SAT ON THE PARK BENCH AND WATCHED THE WORLD GO BY.
THE WAITER BROUGHT THE CHECK AND THEY PAID THE BILL.
SHE LAUGHED AT HIS JOKE AND HE SMILED.
THE AIRPLANE FLEW OVERHEAD, LEAVING A TRAIL OF WHITE SMOKE.
HE PUT ON HIS COAT AND HAT AND WALKED OUT INTO THE COLD.
THE COFFEE WAS HOT AND STRONG.
THE CHILDREN PLAYED IN THE PARK, CHASING EACH OTHER AND LAUGHING.
THE WIND RUSTLED THE LEAVES ON THE TREES.
SHE TURNED ON THE RADIO AND LISTENED TO THE MUSIC.
HE OPENED THE DOOR AND STEPPED OUTSIDE.
THE RAIN WAS FALLING IN A STEADY RHYTHM.
SHE STRETCHED HER ARMS AND YAWNED.
THE CAR DROVE DOWN THE HIGHWAY, PASSING FIELDS AND FORESTS.
HE PICKED UP THE GUITAR AND STRUMMED A FEW CHORDS.
THE PHONE RANG AND SHE ANSWERED IT.
THE BIRD CHIRPED A CHEERFUL TUNE OUTSIDE THE WINDOW.
SHE WROTE A LETTER TO HER FRIEND, TELLING HER ABOUT HER DAY.
THE TRAIN RUMBLED DOWN THE TRACKS, HEADING TOWARDS ITS DESTINATION.
